required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multi-Center, Randomized, Open-Label Study of G/P +/- RBV for NS5A + SOF Previously Treated GT1 HCV Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3b, Multi-Center, Randomized, Open-Label, Pragmatic Study of Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) +/- Ribavirin for GT1 Subjects With Chronic Hepatitis C Previously Treated With an NS5A Inhibitor + Sofosbuvir Therapy

collaborator.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock: The study will enroll well-compensated cirrhotic as well as non-cirrhotic subjects treatment experienced with an NS5a Inhibitor + sofosbuvir and will include patients who did not complete the prescribed duration due to adverse event or any reason other than for non/poor compliance. Subjects will be randomized to 12 or 16 weeks of treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to compare the efficacy and safety of glecaprevir and pibrentasvir (G/P) for 12 weeks to G/P for 16 weeks in non-cirrhotic NS5A (non-structural protein 5a)-inhibitor plus sofosbuvir ± RBV (Ribavirin) treatment-experienced adults with HCV genotype 1 (GT1) infection, and to compare the efficacy and safety of G/P with RBV for 12 weeks to G/P without RBV for 16 weeks in NS5A-inhibitor plus sofosbuvir (SOF) ± RBV treatment-experienced adults with compensated cirrhosis and GT1 infection.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Main Study Up to 225 subjects will be enrolled into 4 study arms A, B, C and D with Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) with or without Ribavirin (RBV). About 75-90 non-cirrhotic subjects will be randomized in a 2:1 ratio to Arms A and B, and about 110-135 compensated cirrhotic subjects will be randomized in a 1:1 ratio to Arms C and D. Non-cirrhotic subjects will be randomized 2:1 to: Arm A: G/P 300 mg/120 mg Once a day for 12 weeks Arm B: G/P 300 mg/120mg Once a day for 16 weeks Subjects with compensated cirrhosis will be randomized 1:1 to: Arm C: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD + weight-based RBV (Ribavirin) Twice a day (1000 mg or 1200 mg total daily dose) for 12 weeks Arm D: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 16 weeks Retreatment sub-study Up to 11 subjects who still have hepatitis C virus after being treated in the Main study will have the option to enter the Retreatment sub-study and receive G/P plus Sofosbuvir and with or without RBV.

primary_outcome.measure: SVR After G/P 12 Wks (Arm A) vs. G/P Given for 16 Weeks (Arm B) to Non-cirrhotic Treatment-experienced GT1 HCV Participants
primary_outcome.description: Number of non-cirrhotic treatment-experienced HCV genotype 1 with a NS5Ai inhibitor + SOF +/-RBV participants with undetectable HCV RNA (HCV RNA <Lower Limit of Quantification -LLOQ) 12 weeks after completing G/P 300 mg/100 mg daily for 12 weeks (Arm A) vs. 16 weeks of G/P 300 mg/100 mg daily (Arm B)

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of Cirrhotic Participants Achieving SVR 12 After G/P Plus RBV for 12 Wks vs. G/P for 16 Wks
primary_outcome.description: Number of cirrhotic participants who are treatment experienced with a NS5A inhibitor + SOF +/RBV with undetectable HCV RNA 12 weeks after completing G/P plus RBV for 12 wks vs. G/P for 16 Wks
Number of subjects who discontinued G/P due to adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in On-Treatment Virologic Failure Between Arms A & B (Non-cirrhotic Subjects)
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in % of subjects with on-treatment virologic failure further defined as either 1)Breakthrough a)Confirmed HCV RNA ≥ 100 IU/mL after HCV RNA < Lower Limit of Quantification (LLOQ) at some point during the Treatment Period or confirmed increase from nadir in HCV RNA (two consecutive measurements > 1 log10 IU/mL above nadir) at any time point during the Treatment Period, or b) a single value indicating viral breakthrough (≥ 100 IU/mL or > 1 log10 above nadir), followed by patient status of 'Lost to Follow-up', the latter not requiring confirmation by a proximate measurement) or 2) End of Treatment Failure defined as HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ at end of treatment and following at least 6 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in Relapse Between Arms A & B in Non-cirrhotic Subjects
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in Post-treatment relapse (defined as confirmed HCV RNA>= Lower limit of quantification (LLOQ) between end of treatment and 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug among subjects who completed treatment as planned with HCV RNA < LLOQ at end of treatment, excluding subjects with subjects with reinfection)

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in On-Treatment Virologic Failure Between Arms C and D in Cirrhotic Subjects
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in percentage of cirrhotic subjects experiencing on-treatment virologic failure (confirmed increase of > 1 log10 IU/mL above nadir during treatment, confirmed HCV RNA ≥ 100 IU/mL after HCV RNA < 15 IU/mL during treatment, or HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ at the end of treatment with at least 6 weeks of treatment) after 12 weeks of G/P with or without RBV for 12 weeks versus 16 weeks of G/P

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in % of Relapse Between Cirrhotic Arms C & D
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in the percentage of compensated cirrhotic subjects with post-treatment relapse (defined as confirmed HCV RNA>=Lower limit of quantification (LLOQ) between end of treatment and 12 weeks after last dose of study drug among subjects who completed treatment as planned with HCV RNA<LLOQ at end of treatment) after receiving 12 weeks G/P +/-Ribavirin (RBV) (Arm C) versus 16 weeks G/P (Arm D)

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in SVR12 Rates for 12-wk vs 16 wk
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in proportions of SVR 12 rates will be determined for 12-week vs. 16-week treatment durations using contrasts within a logistic regression model with cirrhosis status and HCV genotype (1b vs non-1b) as factors

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm A: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 12 Wks
arm_group.description: Non-cirrhotic subjects will take Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg (3 Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 100mg/40mg Tablets once-daily by mouth) for 12 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm B: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 16 Wks
arm_group.description: Non-cirrhotic subjects will take Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg once-daily by mouth for 16 weeks (G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 16 Wks)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm C: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD + RBV 12 Wks
arm_group.description: Cirrhotic subjects will take Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg once daily plus Ribavirin 200Mg Tablet (2-3 tablets) twice a day for 12 weeks (G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD + RBV 12 Wks)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm D: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 16 Wks
arm_group.description: Cirrhotic subjects will take Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg once daily for 16 weeks (G/P 300 mg/120mg QD for 16 Wks)

intervention.arm_group_label: Arm A: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 12 Wks
Arm B: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 16 Wks
Arm C: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD + RBV 12 Wks
Arm D: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 16 Wks
Arm C: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD + RBV 12 Wks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female at least 18 years of age at time of screening.
2. A history of previous treatment with an NS5A-inhibitor plus sofosbuvir therapy ± RBV for chronic HCV genotype 1 infection.
3. Treatment must have been completed at least 1 month prior to Screening Visit.
4. Screening laboratory result indicating chronic HCV GT1 infection. Subjects must be able to understand and adhere to the study visit schedule and all other protocol requirements and must voluntarily sign and date an informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of severe, life-threatening or other significant sensitivity to any drug.
2. Female who is pregnant, planning to become pregnant during the study or breastfeeding; or male whose partner is pregnant or planning to become pregnant during the study.
3. Recent (within 6 months prior to study drug administration) history of drug or alcohol abuse that could preclude adherence to the protocol in the opinion of the investigator.
4. Positive test result at Screening for hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) or anti-human immunodeficiency virus antibody (HIV Ab) in patient without known history of HIV infection.
5. HCV genotype performed during screening indicating co-infection with more than one HCV genotype.
6. History or presence of liver decompensation.

facility.name: Schiff Center for Liver Diseases/University of Miami
The Johns Hopkins Hospital/John G. Bartlett Specialty Practice
Univ. of Minnesota Health Clinics and Surgery Center, Inc.
Northwell Health - Sandra Atlaas Bass Center for Liver Diseases
University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
University of Pennsylvania-Perelman Center for Advanced Medicine
Bon Secours Liver Institute of Virginia

measure.title: APRI
measure.description: AST to Platelet Ratio Index (APRI) (AST Level (IU/L)/AST (Upper Limit of Normal) (IU/L))/Platelet Count (109/L) * 100

measure.title: HIV
measure.description: Number of patients with HIV at baseline

outcome.title: Difference in On-Treatment Virologic Failure Between Arms A & B (Non-cirrhotic Subjects)
outcome.description: Difference in % of subjects with on-treatment virologic failure further defined as either 1)Breakthrough a)Confirmed HCV RNA ≥ 100 IU/mL after HCV RNA < Lower Limit of Quantification (LLOQ) at some point during the Treatment Period or confirmed increase from nadir in HCV RNA (two consecutive measurements > 1 log10 IU/mL above nadir) at any time point during the Treatment Period, or b) a single value indicating viral breakthrough (≥ 100 IU/mL or > 1 log10 above nadir), followed by patient status of 'Lost to Follow-up', the latter not requiring confirmation by a proximate measurement) or 2) End of Treatment Failure defined as HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ at end of treatment and following at least 6 weeks of treatment.
outcome.population: Analysis was performed the study population "as treated" further defined as mITT-all subjects representing their actual study regimen and who received at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: Arms A G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 12 Weeks
group.description: Arms A includes non-cirrhotic subjects receiving Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg once-daily by mouth with or without Ribavirin for 12 weeks (Arm A) Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg: daily

group.title: Arm B G/P 300/120mg Once Daily for 16 Weeks
group.description: Arm B includes non-cirrhotic subjects receiving Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg once-daily by mouth for 16 weeks (G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 16 Wks) Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg: daily

measure.title: Difference in On-Treatment Virologic Failure Between Arms A & B (Non-cirrhotic Subjects)
measure.description: Difference in % of subjects with on-treatment virologic failure further defined as either 1)Breakthrough a)Confirmed HCV RNA ≥ 100 IU/mL after HCV RNA < Lower Limit of Quantification (LLOQ) at some point during the Treatment Period or confirmed increase from nadir in HCV RNA (two consecutive measurements > 1 log10 IU/mL above nadir) at any time point during the Treatment Period, or b) a single value indicating viral breakthrough (≥ 100 IU/mL or > 1 log10 above nadir), followed by patient status of 'Lost to Follow-up', the latter not requiring confirmation by a proximate measurement) or 2) End of Treatment Failure defined as HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ at end of treatment and following at least 6 weeks of treatment.
measure.population: Analysis was performed the study population "as treated" further defined as mITT-all subjects representing their actual study regimen and who received at least one dose of study drug.

analysis.groups_desc: The difference in the percentage of subjects with on-treatment virologic failure (Defined as increase of >1 log10 IU/mL above nadir during treatment, or HCV RNA >= 15 IU/mL at end of treatment with at least 6 weeks of treatment between Arms A and B are summarized with two-sided 95% Wilson score intervals.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Study is not intended to be powered

outcome.title: Difference in Relapse Between Arms A & B in Non-cirrhotic Subjects
outcome.description: Difference in Post-treatment relapse (defined as confirmed HCV RNA>= Lower limit of quantification (LLOQ) between end of treatment and 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug among subjects who completed treatment as planned with HCV RNA < LLOQ at end of treatment, excluding subjects with subjects with reinfection)
outcome.population: Analysis performed on any subject with study drug duration of 77 days or greater for Arm A or 105 days or greater for Arm B

group.title: Arm A: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 12 Wks
group.description: Non-cirrhotic subjects receiving Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg (3 Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 100mg/40mg Tablets once-daily by mouth) for 12 weeks. Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg: daily

measure.title: Difference in Relapse Between Arms A & B in Non-cirrhotic Subjects
measure.description: Difference in Post-treatment relapse (defined as confirmed HCV RNA>= Lower limit of quantification (LLOQ) between end of treatment and 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug among subjects who completed treatment as planned with HCV RNA < LLOQ at end of treatment, excluding subjects with subjects with reinfection)
measure.population: Analysis performed on any subject with study drug duration of 77 days or greater for Arm A or 105 days or greater for Arm B

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The difference in the percentage of subjects with post-treatment relapse between Arms A and B are summarized with two-sided 95% Wilson score intervals.

outcome.population: Analysis was performed the study population "as treated" further defined as mITT-all subjects representing their actual study regimen and who received at least one dose of study drug.

measure.title: Difference in On-Treatment Virologic Failure Between Arms C and D in Cirrhotic Subjects
measure.description: Difference in percentage of cirrhotic subjects experiencing on-treatment virologic failure (confirmed increase of > 1 log10 IU/mL above nadir during treatment, confirmed HCV RNA ≥ 100 IU/mL after HCV RNA < 15 IU/mL during treatment, or HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ at the end of treatment with at least 6 weeks of treatment) after 12 weeks of G/P with or without RBV for 12 weeks versus 16 weeks of G/P
measure.population: Analysis was performed the study population "as treated" further defined as mITT-all subjects representing their actual study regimen and who received at least one dose of study drug.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Difference in percentage of subjects with on-treatment virologic failure between Arms C and D will be summarized with two-sided 95% Wilson score intervals

outcome.title: Difference in % of Relapse Between Cirrhotic Arms C & D
outcome.description: Difference in the percentage of compensated cirrhotic subjects with post-treatment relapse (defined as confirmed HCV RNA>=Lower limit of quantification (LLOQ) between end of treatment and 12 weeks after last dose of study drug among subjects who completed treatment as planned with HCV RNA<LLOQ at end of treatment) after receiving 12 weeks G/P +/-Ribavirin (RBV) (Arm C) versus 16 weeks G/P (Arm D)

group.title: Arm C: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD + RBV 12 Wks
group.description: Cirrhotic subjects will take Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg once daily plus Ribavirin 200Mg Tablet (2-3 tablets) twice a day for 12 weeks (G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD + RBV 12 Wks) Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg: daily Ribavirin 200Mg Tablet: Weight-based 1000-1200 mg

measure.title: Difference in % of Relapse Between Cirrhotic Arms C & D
measure.description: Difference in the percentage of compensated cirrhotic subjects with post-treatment relapse (defined as confirmed HCV RNA>=Lower limit of quantification (LLOQ) between end of treatment and 12 weeks after last dose of study drug among subjects who completed treatment as planned with HCV RNA<LLOQ at end of treatment) after receiving 12 weeks G/P +/-Ribavirin (RBV) (Arm C) versus 16 weeks G/P (Arm D)

outcome.title: Difference in SVR12 Rates for 12-wk vs 16 wk
outcome.description: Difference in proportions of SVR 12 rates will be determined for 12-week vs. 16-week treatment durations using contrasts within a logistic regression model with cirrhosis status and HCV genotype (1b vs non-1b) as factors
outcome.population: Modified Intent to Treat Population (mITT) analysis (All subjects enroll in Main study receiving at least one dose of study drug and according to the treatment arm in which they were actually treated)

group.title: Arm A: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 12 Wks
group.description: Non-cirrhotic subjects will take Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg (3 Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 100mg/40mg Tablets once-daily by mouth) for 12 weeks. Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg: daily

group.title: Arm B: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 16 Wks
group.description: Non-cirrhotic subjects will take Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg once-daily by mouth for 16 weeks (G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 16 Wks) Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg: daily

group.title: Arm C: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD + RBV 12 Wks
group.description: Cirrhotic subjects will take Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg once daily plus Ribavirin 200Mg Tablet (2-3 tablets) twice a day for 12 weeks (G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD + RBV 12 Wks) Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg: daily Ribavirin 200Mg Tablet: Weight-based 1000-1200 mg

group.description: Cirrhotic subjects will take Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg once daily for 16 weeks (G/P 300 mg/120mg QD for 16 Wks) Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg: daily

measure.title: Difference in SVR12 Rates for 12-wk vs 16 wk
measure.description: Difference in proportions of SVR 12 rates will be determined for 12-week vs. 16-week treatment durations using contrasts within a logistic regression model with cirrhosis status and HCV genotype (1b vs non-1b) as factors
measure.population: Modified Intent to Treat Population (mITT) analysis (All subjects enroll in Main study receiving at least one dose of study drug and according to the treatment arm in which they were actually treated)

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Study was not powered to compare efficacy
analysis.method_desc: Logistic regression contrast estimates with Wald confidence intervals and Chi-square p values
analysis.estimate_desc: Comparison of Arm Pair A/C versus B/D overall on mITT population

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Study is not powered to compare efficacy of 12 wks vs 16 weeks of treatment
analysis.method_desc: Logistic regression contrast estimates with Wald confidence intervals and Chi-square p values
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference in proportion of SVR12 rates for 12 vs 16 weeks on mITT Comparing Cirrhotic subjects versus non-cirrhotic subjects.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of 12 weeks vs 16 weeks in Genotype 1b vs non-1b

group.title: Arm A: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 12 Wks
group.description: Non-cirrhotic subjects will take Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg (3 Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 100mg/40mg Tablets once-daily by mouth) for 12 weeks. Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg: daily

group.title: Arm B: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 16 Wks
group.description: Non-cirrhotic subjects will take Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg once-daily by mouth for 16 weeks (G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 16 Wks) Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg: daily

group.title: Arm C: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD + RBV 12 Wks
group.description: Cirrhotic subjects will take Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg once daily plus Ribavirin 200Mg Tablet (2-3 tablets) twice a day for 12 weeks (G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD + RBV 12 Wks) Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg: daily Ribavirin 200Mg Tablet: Weight-based 1000-1200 mg

group.title: Arm D: G/P 300 mg/120 mg QD for 16 Wks
group.description: Cirrhotic subjects will take Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg once daily for 16 weeks (G/P 300 mg/120mg QD for 16 Wks) Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir (G/P) 300mg/120mg: daily

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This study did not include a group that received 16 weeks of glecaprevir and pibrentasvir with ribavirin.
